summary: Yvonne W. Briggs was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). She is listed in multiple payroll and certification reports from 1978, specifically in May, October, and November. These documents detail her position, annual salary, and earnings during those pay periods. The documents do not specify her exact role within the HSCA, but her inclusion in these reports indicates she was a staff member during the committee's investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Yvonne W. Briggs' significance lies in her employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While her specific role is not detailed in these documents, her presence on the payroll indicates she contributed to the committee's work.
